mental_health_conditions.name: Anxiety
mental_health_conditions.description: Anxiety is a mental health condition characterized by persistent, excessive worry or fear.

mental_health_conditions.name: Depression
mental_health_conditions.description: Depression is a mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest.

mental_health_conditions.name: Schizophrenia
mental_health_conditions.description: Schizophrenia is a serious mental disorder characterized by abnormal interpretations of reality.

mental_health_conditions.name: Bipolar Disorder
mental_health_conditions.description: Bipolar disorder, formerly known as manic-depressive illness, involves extreme mood swings from high (manic) to low (depressive) phases.

mental_health_conditions.name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
mental_health_conditions.description: OCD is characterized by intrusive thoughts and repetitive behaviors aimed at reducing anxiety.

mental_health_conditions.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
symptoms: Negative changes in mood and thinking
mental_health_conditions.description: PTSD can develop after exposure to a traumatic event and is characterized by persistent symptoms that interfere with daily life.

mental_health_conditions.name: Eating Disorders
mental_health_conditions.description: Eating disorders, such as anorexia nervosa and bulimia nervosa, involve extreme emotions, attitudes, and behaviors related to food and weight.
